adverbs.description: unbelievably (comparative more unbelievably, superlative most unbelievably)

entries.meaning: (manner) In a manner that one does not or cannot believe.
examples: He gestured unbelievably. Everyone knew he was faking his illness.

entries.meaning: (degree) To an extent not to be believed.
examples: His face turned unbelievably blue. We realized he was actually choking.
Unbelievably, Rudy saved the man's life but got sued for breaking two of his ribs.
